SEARCH
Package com.xebisco.yield

Klasse Animation

java.lang.Object
com.xebisco.yield.Animation
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
Disposable
public class Animation extends Object implements Disposable
The Animation class represents a sequence of textures with a delay and loop option, and can be disposed.

    • getFrames

      public Texture[] getFrames()
      The function returns an array of Texture objects.
      Gibt zurück:
      An array of Texture objects named "frames" is being returned.

    • setFrames

      public void setFrames(Texture[] frames)
      This function sets the frames of a texture.
      Parameter:
      frames - The "frames" parameter is an array of Texture objects. The method "setFrames" sets the value of the instance variable "frames" to the value of the "frames" parameter.

    • getDelay

      public double getDelay()
      The function returns the value of the delay variable as a double.
      Gibt zurück:
      The method `getDelay()` is returning a `double` value, which is the value of the variable `delay`.

    • setDelay

      public void setDelay(double delay)
      The function sets the delay value for a certain object.
      Parameter:
      delay - The "delay" parameter is a double data type that represents the amount of time (in seconds) to wait before going to the next frame. This method sets the value of the "delay" instance variable to the specified value passed as a parameter.

    • isLoop

      public boolean isLoop()
      The function returns a boolean value indicating whether the animation will loop or not.
      Gibt zurück:
      The method `isLoop()` is returning a boolean value, which is the value of the variable `loop`.

    • setLoop

      public void setLoop(boolean loop)
      This function sets the value of a boolean variable called "loop".
      Parameter:
      loop - The "loop" parameter is a boolean variable that is used to control whether the animation will loop or not. If the value of "loop" is true, then the animation will be repeated indefinitely until it is explicitly stopped or interrupted.
